de.jannlab.math

Class MathTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.math.MathTools

  • public class MathTools
extends Object
    This class provides some frequently used mathematical helper methods.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean approxNull(double value)
      Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold NULL_THRESHOLD_DOUBLE.

      Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold given by errorbound.

      Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold NULL_THRESHOLD_FLOAT.

      Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold given by errorbound.

      Return the index of the biggest values in an array of doubles.
      static int argmin(double... args)
      Return the index of the smallest values in an array of doubles.
      static double clamp(double value, double lbd, double ubd)
      Clamps a given value x returned as x' within the interval [lbd, ubd] such that x' = lbd if x < lbd, x' = ubd if x > ubd or x' = x otherwise.
      static double fastExp(double value)
      Computes the apprixmation of the exponential function e^{x} using the interpretation of IEEE-754 numbers.
      static double fastTanh(double value)
      Computes a fast tanh function based on the approximation of the expontial function.

    • Method Detail

      • approxNull

        public static boolean approxNull(double value)
        Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold NULL_THRESHOLD_DOUBLE.

        Parameters:
        value - The value which is to check.
        Returns:
        True if absolute of the given value is smaller than the threshold.

      • approxNull

        public static boolean approxNull(float value)
        Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold NULL_THRESHOLD_FLOAT.

        Parameters:
        value - The value which is to check.
        Returns:
        True if absolute of the given value is smaller than the threshold.

      • approxNull

        public static boolean approxNull(double value,
                 double errorbound)
        Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold given by errorbound.

        Parameters:
        value - The value which is to check.
        errorbound - The explicitly given threshold.
        Returns:
        True if absolute of the given value is smaller than the threshold.

      • approxNull

        public static boolean approxNull(float value,
                 float errorbound)
        Checks, if the given value is approximately 0.0 based on the threshold given by errorbound.

        Parameters:
        value - The value which is to check.
        errorbound - The explicitly given threshold.
        Returns:
        True if absolute of the given value is smaller than the threshold.

      • fastExp

        public static double fastExp(double value)
        Computes the apprixmation of the exponential function e^{x} using the interpretation of IEEE-754 numbers.

        References:

        Schraudolph, Nicol N.: A Fast, Compact Approximation of the Exponential Function. In:Neural Computation11 (1998), S. 11???4

        Optimized Exponential Functions for Java. http://martin.ankerl.com/2007/02/11/optimized-exponential- functions-for-java/, 2007. ??? Visited on Januar, 12st 2012

        Parameters:
        value - The argument of the exp function.
        Returns:
        Approximation of e^{x}.

      • fastTanh

        public static double fastTanh(double value)
        Computes a fast tanh function based on the approximation of the expontial function.

        Parameters:
        value - The argument of the tanh function.
        Returns:
        Approximation of tanh(x).

      • argmax

        public static int argmax(double... args)
        Return the index of the biggest values in an array of doubles. Returns -1 if an empty array is given.

        Parameters:
        args - Double array.
        Returns:
        The index of the biggest value.

      • argmin

        public static int argmin(double... args)
        Return the index of the smallest values in an array of doubles. Returns -1 if an empty array is given.

        Parameters:
        args - Double array.
        Returns:
        The index of the smallest value.

      • clamp

        public static double clamp(double value,
           double lbd,
           double ubd)
        Clamps a given value x returned as x' within the interval [lbd, ubd] such that x' = lbd if x < lbd, x' = ubd if x > ubd or x' = x otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - The given value.
        lbd - Lower bound of the clamp interval.
        ubd - Upper bound of the clamp interval.
        Returns:
        A values within the interval [lbd, ubd]
